The two discussed what the pope called the tyranny of the markets as Kerviel sought divine help through God 's representative on earth in his legal struggle .

Kerviel was sentenced to three years in prison for making unauthorised trades that lost the French investment bank €4.9bn ( £3.9bn , $ 6.7bn ) .
French regulators got SocGen to pay a €4 m fine for failures in its risk control systems following the scandal .

A 2008 poll revealed that 77 % of French respondents viewed the former trader as a victim .
